question: What are the core DevOps practices that enable continuous delivery and collaboration?
answer: DevOps practices include CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code, automated testing, monitoring, and fostering collaboration between development and operations teams.
explanation:
DevOps practices enable faster, more reliable software delivery through automation and collaboration:

## Technical Practices
- **Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)** - Automated build, test, and deployment pipelines
- **Infrastructure as Code (IaC)** - Managing infrastructure through version-controlled code
- **Automated Testing** - Unit, integration, and end-to-end test automation
- **Monitoring & Observability** - Real-time system health and performance tracking
- **Configuration Management** - Consistent environment setup and management

## Cultural Practices
- **Collaboration** - Breaking down silos between Dev and Ops teams
- **Shared Responsibility** - Joint ownership of application lifecycle
- **Blameless Post-mortems** - Learning from failures without blame
- **Continuous Learning** - Regular skill development and knowledge sharing

## Process Practices
- **Version Control** - Git-based code and configuration management
- **Agile Methodology** - Iterative development with short feedback loops
- **Release Management** - Controlled, predictable software releases
- **Incident Response** - Structured approach to handling production issues
diagram:
graph TD
    A[Development Team] --> B[Version Control]
    B --> C[CI/CD Pipeline]
    C --> D[Automated Testing]
    D --> E[Staging Environment]
    E --> F[Production Deployment]
    F --> G[Monitoring & Alerts]
    G --> H[Operations Team]
    H --> I[Incident Response]
    I --> A
    J[Infrastructure as Code] --> E
    J --> F
    K[Configuration Management] --> E
    K --> F
